body:
**Renovate**

- fork mode ("Forking Renovate")
  - GreenKeeper has a legitimate reason for write access to repo because it adds labels to PR; this was done to avoid impersonation (not impersonating a commit, but someone creating an account called "Greenkeeper" with different characters)
  - Renovate does request permission for write access to issues to label their own PRs
  - design doc has details on exactly which permissions are asked for and why
  - Malte's a fan of the forking mode
- doesn't trigger a PR build & a push build
- switchover cost
  - very quick to install it as an app
  - there's an onboarding PR (configure renovate) with a preview; you can also add config (e.g. send all PRs to someone)
- Raghu: there are some clear advantages to this
- a followup meeting will be scheduled to discuss
